properties.name: Burnhamthorpe Library
properties.notes: Burnhamthrope Library is a library that offers a wide range of services and resources to the Mississauga community, focusing on accessibility and inclusivity for all patrons. Free public access; library card required for borrowing and some services.

properties.name: Malton Library
properties.notes: public library that serves the diverse and vibrant nearby communities. It offers a wide range of services and resources, focusing on accessibility and inclusivity for all patrons.

properties.name: Design With
properties.notes:
- Most technologies and workshops offered fall under the boutique category (sewing, mending, etc.)
- Collaberates with other organizations/schools/makerspaces to hold workshops or to make innovate or interesting products in other makerspace locations. 
- Access mose includes classes, (free) workshops, and appointments

properties.name: HackLab.to
properties.notes: open to newcomers on tuesday

properties.name: Paperhouse Studio
properties.notes: experimental arts studio and collective rooted in paper as the medium

properties.name: Toronto Tool Library
properties.notes:
There are many more tools available on the website such as different companies, size, and variation.
This is actually not a makerspace, The Toronto Tool Library is just a place where you can rent out equipment and tool. They have a seperate makerspce where you can use these equipment in their makerspce which is the TTL makerspace.

properties.name: MAKO Design + Invent
properties.notes: The website advertises end-to-end product development services, but does not list the specific technology available. However, since they are a product development firm with no specific field of expertise, one can assume that they have a vast amount of tools that can aid with any project, design, or idea. They also provide patent referrals.

properties.name: prototyping spaces at the Schwartz-Reisman Innovation Campus - West Tower FOUR
properties.address: 108 College Street, to open in fall
properties.notes: As this makerspace isn't open yet, there isn't much extra info.

properties.name: RCC 194 TMU Maker Space
properties.email: rta@torontomu.ca (general, email gets forwarded to specific staff to best help)
properties.notes: The makerspace was difficult to locate, and only accessible with a TMU student ID. It is meant for students in the New Media Program, classes will be hosted there, though other TMU students are welcome to visit. It is open 24/7 but there are specific day hours where staff will be available to teach and assist (Monday to Friday 8AM-4:30PM).

properties.name: STEAM Labs
properties.notes: The non-for-profit organization focuses on helping people to understand and think critically of leading-edge science and technology for them to be able to employ the tools in their lives in addition to being knowledgeable and proactive participants in the discussions we must have as a society ensuring they are deployed with fairness, accountability, trust and ethics. As such, it provides educators with teaching kits which contain written instructions, videos, and applications (on a variety of different topics including but not limited to artificial intelligence and internet of things) as well as classes/workshops/pop-ups for students of different ages where they teach them how to make use of technologies such as micro:bit.

properties.name: ROM Makerspace
properties.notes: First, the main purpose of ROM Makerspace is to support education, research and cultural preservation. It provides resources and tools for creating and experimenting with new technologies and engaging the community in museum-related projects. Second, it provides a better experience for the ROM museum, where visitors can also interact with and learn about history while visiting.

properties.name: GTA Woodworks
properties.notes: owned or lended to us by members, so we regularly add new gear.

properties.name: GTA Woodworks
properties.notes: A mix of appointments to use the provided tools and get help from the owner and classes that teach different parts of wood working.

properties.name: TPL Digital Innovation Hub Albert Campbell
properties.notes:
To use equipment, talk to staff at a Digital Innovation Hub.
                • A valid Toronto Public Library card is required.
                • You will need to complete and sign an equipment loan form before you can check out equipment. Customers under the age of 18 need to have the form signed by their parent or guardian in person.
                • Equipment can be checked out for up to two hours and renewed only if available.
Full replacement cost is charged for lost or damaged equipment.

properties.name: TPL Digital Innovation Hub Albion
properties.notes:

                • A valid Toronto Public Library card is required.
                • You will need to complete and sign an equipment loan form before you can check out equipment. Customers under the age of 18 need to have the form signed by their parent or guardian in person.
                • Equipment can be checked out for up to two hours and renewed only if available.
Full replacement cost is charged for lost or damaged equipment.

properties.notes: TPL Digital Innovation Hub offers various 3D printers like Ultimaker, Original Prusa, Tevo, and Prusa MK3S+, as well as Canon HD and DSLR cameras, dynamic and condenser microphones, vinyl printers/cutters, and MIDI keyboards.

properties.name: Georgetown Branch of the Halton Hills Public Library Makerspace
properties.notes: The Georgetown Branch of the Halton Hills Public Library offers a makerspace for scanning, editing, and converting photos and videos, as well as hardware and software that you can use for your creative photo, audio and video projects.

properties.name: Central Branch Burlington Public Library
properties.notes:
MakerSpace is a small-scale do-it-yourself workshop where you can create designs and use equipment to complete your projects. Unless noted, the MakerSpace at Central Branch, 3rd floor, is open:
Mon, Fri, Sat: 10am-4:30pm; Saturday closed 1-2pm
Tue, Wed, Thu: 10am-8:30pm
Sun: Closed

properties.name: Humber Prototype Lab
properties.address: 205 Humber College Blvd., Barrett Centre For Technology Innovation
properties.notes:
Staff on site to assist with plugging files into the machines. 
For students and members of the Humber community

properties.name: Loyalist College The FailSafe
properties.notes:
No membership, all students, staff, and faculty of Loyalist College can use the facility.
The facility provide 3D print material like PLA and PTEG to students at no charge currently.  For our laser cutter, we don’t provide any material.
Open Hour: Sept- April: Mon-Fri 8 a.m. – 7 p.m., and Sat 10 a.m.-6pm. 
May – Aug: Mon-Fri 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. 
The facility is bookable students, staff, and faculty, not the general public. 
Machine/Computers/Software included in the facility:
Bambu Labs 3D printers : X1 Carbon (3), A1-Mini (2), P1S (2)
Dremel 40-watt Laser Cutter
Meta Quest Pro VR units (2)
Small and Large Audio Booths  (Large one has 4K webcam and pull-down green screen
Alienware eSports PCs (10)

properties.name: Ultimate Workshop
properties.notes: Excluisve Welcome Kit, VIP access or perks, One- on-one coaching and membership

properties.name: Queer Computer Club
properties.notes:
Don't have to be a queer, it is because -- emphasize our focus on making a space for LGBT+ people, everyone is welcome.
The business hours of the building are: Monday to Friday: 6:30 a.m. - 9:30 p.m. Saturday and Sunday: 8:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.
Outside of these hours, access to the building requires a keyfob for the front door and to operate the elevator. Members are given a fob so they can access the space at any time.

properties.name: Cory Trépanier Creativity Studio (CTCS) Caledon East branch Caledon Public Library
properties.notes: 3D printers, lasers, and vinyl cutters may require instruction or training. The library offers classes and one-on-one meetings with maker professionals to assist users get started with these tools. You need a library card to use the maker space and equipment.

The Scugog Library Makerspace
properties.email: Directly message on website, no email provided
properties.notes: All customers 14 and over must have a completed waiver before accessing Makerspace services. Those under 18 must have a parent or legal guardian sign on their behalf. Children under 14 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian while in the Makerspace.

properties.name: Mary Street Community School maker space
properties.notes: Not open for general public

properties.name: Makerspace @ McLean Ajax Library
properties.notes:
Primarily walk-in, with scheduled workshops and meetings available.
Open to the public, including individuals, groups, and school groups.
Skills Required: None; a willingness to learn is encouraged, with limited guidance provided for task completion.
Requires a free Ajax library card (quick process) and a signed waiver for equipment usage.
Equipment use is free, but users are charged for materials (can bring their own).
Purpose: To foster a community of creators and learners by providing the tools and space for hands-on projects and skill development.

Monday to Friday | 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.
Saturday | 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Sunday | 11:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

MAKE IT! space Vaughan Public Pierre Berton Resource Library
properties.notes: The Vaughan Public Library's Makerspaces have specialized equipment, including a button maker, a Carvey tabletop carving machine, and a direct-to-garment printer. There are instruments such as the Oculus Rift (currently unavailable) and different 3D modeling software for digital design. The Recording Studio is outfitted with high-performance audio interfaces and various musical instruments.

CREATE IT! space Vaughan Public Civic Centre Resource Library
Delano Academy's STE(A)M factory Thornhill Campus
Proto 3000
properties.notes: The organization focuses on providing end-to-end advanced manufacturing solutions that leverage design, additive manufacturing, and metrology to reduce product design cycles, enhance prototyping capabilities, improve production efficiency, and maximize supply-chain flexibility. It differs from other types of makerspaces as it does not allow people to directly access the technology (unless they purchase it).

properties.name: Maker's Space & Studio Clarington Library, Museums & Archives Courtice Library
properties.notes: Users should understand that the space is designed for learners of all ages and skill levels. Users will need to go over the instructions and tuition before access the technology. properties.notes: OCAD’s Experimental Fabrication Studio (XFab) provides Speed 100 and Trotec laser cutters (max cut size 24x12 inches, 1/8 inch acrylic thickness), BotFactory for PCB printing, Bantam Tools Desktop CNC Milling Machine (4th axis compatible), and woodshop tools like drill presses, saws, routers, and sanders.

properties.name: Daniels Digital Fabrication Lab & Model Workshop
Machine Shop - Dept of Mechanical & Industrial Eng
properties.notes:
Student Machine Shop Access (only UoT engineering students):
Available for U of T academic projects and student clubs.
Students must complete a two-day basic machining course at George Brown College and pass U of T’s Site-Specific Training.

Professional Services:
Provides design consultation, precision machining, and prototype assembly for faculty and student research.

Rates: $67.50/hour for MIE faculty and students, $77.50/hour for other U of T departments, and $5/hour for 3D printing (plus material costs).

The makerspace (student machine shop & professional services) serves the U of T community only, excluding work for corporations, alumni, or private individuals.
